title: Update Ocean Empowerer Solutions logo assets and wire new branding across the frontend

requirements.summary: Generate a bold, youthful, forward-thinking typographic logo set (horizontal, icon, social) with high legibility at small sizes.
acceptanceCriteria: New logo design direction is clearly typographic (font-led) and reads as bold/unique
Color treatment communicates a youthful and forward-thinking brand impression
Logo remains readable at header size (approx. 36â€“40px tall) and icon size (256x256)

file_operations.description: Add the newly generated horizontal typographic logo asset (512x128) that matches the bold/youthful/growth-oriented direction.
Add the newly generated icon logo mark asset (256x256) designed for small-size legibility.
Add the newly generated wide social-sharing logo lockup asset (512x256) suitable for OG/Twitter previews.

Rename the previous horizontal logo asset to the new filename: rename to frontend/public/assets/generated/bold-youthful-logo-horizontal.dim_512x128.png (only if the old file currently exists and is being replaced).

Rename the previous icon logo asset to the new filename: rename to frontend/public/assets/generated/bold-youthful-logo-icon.dim_256x256.png (only if the old file currently exists and is being replaced).

Rename the previous social logo asset to the new filename: rename to frontend/public/assets/generated/bold-youthful-logo-social.dim_512x256.png (only if the old file currently exists and is being replaced).

requirements.summary: Update brand asset references to use the new generated logo filenames everywhere the logo appears (including SEO/social meta tags).
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/src/lib/brandAssets.ts points to the new horizontal, icon, and social logo asset paths under /assets/generated/
The header and footer logo render the new horizontal logo via BRAND_ASSETS.logoHorizontal
OpenGraph/Twitter social image in frontend/index.html uses the new social logo asset filename (not the old one)
SEO structured data continues to use BRAND_ASSETS.logoSocial (no regression)

file_operations.description: Update BRAND_ASSETS.logoHorizontal, BRAND_ASSETS.logoIcon, BRAND_ASSETS.logoSocial (and corresponding *Jpg aliases) to point to /assets/generated/bold-youthful-logo-horizontal.dim_512x128.png, /assets/generated/bold-youthful-logo-icon.dim_256x256.png, and /assets/generated/bold-youthful-logo-social.dim_512x256.png.
Update og:image and twitter:image meta tags to reference /assets/generated/bold-youthful-logo-social.dim_512x256.png, replacing any previous social logo filename.
Verify the header logo renders via BRAND_ASSETS.logoHorizontal and that no hardcoded legacy logo paths remain; update only if any legacy paths are found.
Verify the footer logo and logo download link use BRAND_ASSETS.* and that no hardcoded legacy logo paths remain; update only if any legacy paths are found.
Verify structured data continues to source the organization logo from BRAND_ASSETS.logoSocial (no regression); update only if any hardcoded legacy paths are found.

requirements.summary: Ensure new logo assets are present under frontend/public/assets/generated and prevent broken logo links at runtime/build.
acceptanceCriteria: All new logo files exist in frontend/public/assets/generated with the expected filenames
No missing-image placeholders or 404s occur for logo assets in header, footer, or social meta image

file_operations.description: Create a small non-visual component that preloads BRAND_ASSETS.logoHorizontal/logoIcon/logoSocial on app mount and logs a warning if any fail to load, helping detect missing static assets early.
Wire BrandAssetPreloader into the app composition so logo assets are preloaded during normal rendering without changing site layout/content.
